MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Pausing a Campaign Flow in Marketing Cloud Growth

Although it’s rare, sometimes you need to stop a campaign’s flow from running. You can pause a preparing, activated, or finishing segment-triggered campaign flow so that you can fix an issue or make other changes.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create and edit flows:	

Marketing Manager permission set

OR

View Flows and Create and Edit Flows user permissions AND Permissions to all elements in the flow

Learn more about Marketing Cloud Growth Permissions

How It Works

A flow must have a status of Preparing, Activated, or Finishing to be paused. When you pause, the segment members are held where they are until you resume the flow. When you resume, Flow Builder processes the segment members in the paused queue where they were when you paused the flow.

Flow Builder accounts for the time elapsed since you paused the flow. If your flow contains a Wait for Amount of Time or Wait Until Date element, the flow, the pause duration is included in the total wait time.

When you resume a changed flow, you must create a new flow version. Before you activate the new version, choose to complete any work, such as unsent email or SMS messages, or cancel them.

Complete work: Previous work is completed and the new activated version processes all new work.
Cancel work: Queued work from the previous paused version is permanently deleted.
EXAMPLE
You pause your email campaign flow because you have updated artwork. You want to send queued emails from the previous version, but send the updated version to anyone who hasn’t started the flow yet. When you activate the new version of the paused campaign flow, you choose to complete work.
Your campaign’s email is intended for existing high value customers. You pause your email campaign flow when you realize that the audience segment includes new customers only. You don’t want anyone else to get the email because the information isn’t intended for new customers. When you activate a new version with the correct segment, you choose to cancel work.
Your email series has a Wait for Amount of Time element that is set to wait 48 hours. Twelve hours into the pause period, you pause the flow for 12 hours, and then resume it. Since 24 hours have elapsed since you paused the flow, it begins sending the next email 24 hours later.
Pause a Campaign Flow

In Marketing Cloud Growth, you can pause a segment-triggered flow from the Flow Builder canvas.

Open a flow for editing.
From a single email campaign, click the action menu, and then select Edit Flow.
From other campaigns, click Edit Flow.
From the Flows tab, click a row action menu, and then select View Flow.
On the button bar, click Pause.
Add a reason for pausing the flow.
Click Pause.

The status badge changes to Paused. When you’re ready to resume your flow, click Resume. If you edited your flow, the current version of the flow remains on the campaign until you activate the new version.

Deactivate a Paused Campaign Flow

In Marketing Cloud Growth, you can deactivate a paused segment-triggered flow from the Flow Builder canvas.

Before you deactivate a paused flow, decide whether to allow individuals in the flow to complete it or to cancel the flow completely and remove all individuals from the flow.

Complete work: The flow deactivates, but remains in Finishing status until all individuals already in it to complete it.
Cancel work: The flow deactivates immediately and shows a status of Canceled.
Open the paused flow for editing.
From a single email campaign, click the action menu, and then select Edit Flow.
From other campaigns, click Edit Flow.
From the Flows tab, click a row action menu, and then select View Flow.
Click Deactivate.
Choose what to do with in-progress work.
To deactivate the flow and cancel in-progress work, select Deactivate and complete work.
To deactivate the flow and complete any in-progress work, select Deactivate and complete work.
Click Deactivate.
When you cancel in-progress work, the status badge changes to Canceled.
When you complete in-progress work, the status badge changes to Finishing. After the flow finishes the in-progress work, the status changes to Canceled.
Pause Support by Flow Status

In Marketing Cloud Growth, flows can be paused when they have certain statuses only.

Can I Pause a Segment-Triggered Flow?
FLOW STATUS	CAN YOU PAUSE?	DETAILS
Preparing	Yes	A flow that’s preparing resources hasn’t started processing data yet, so you can pause it. If you edit the flow, you must save it as a new version.
Activated	Yes	An activated flow is running, but you can pause it. If you edit the flow, you must save it as a new version.
Finishing	Yes	A flow that’s finishing allows individuals who were in the flow when it was canceled to complete it, but doesn’t accept new individuals. A flow that's finishing can be paused because the flow is still running. If you edit the flow, you must save it as a new version.
Completed	No	The flow finished running so it can’t be paused.
Scheduled	No	A scheduled flow can’t be paused because it hasn’t started running. However, you can deactivate it, make changes, and activate it again.
Canceled	No	A canceled flow can’t be modified or paused, but you can save it as a new version, make changes, and activate it.
Draft	No	A draft flow hasn’t been activated yet, so it can’t be paused.
Error	No	A flow with an error status can’t be paused because it’s not running. Review error details for instructions on how to address the error.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Pausing Campaign Flows in Marketing Cloud Growth
